thread.title: Pakistan set India 198-run target in Blind World T20 final
thread.title_full: Pakistan set India 198-run target in Blind World T20 final

author: Our Correspondent
title: Pakistan set India 198-run target in Blind World T20 final
text:
Share Tweet Email PHOTO COURTESY: PBCC 
KARACHI: Badar Munirâ€™s half-century helped Pakistan Blind Cricket team post a steep target of 198 runs against hosts India in the final of the T20 World Cup for Blind. 
Pakistan, the only unbeaten team in the tournament so far, scored 197-9 after Munir scored 57 off 37 balls, hitting eight fours and one six. Pakistan, India to meet in final of T20 Blind World Cup 
He was well supported by Muhammad Jamil, who scored 24 off 15 balls, as the two were involved in a 58-run stand. 
Amir Ishfaq (20), Riasat Khan (16), Muhammad Zafar (16) and Mattiullah (15) all chipped in with handy cameos to take Pakistan to the total.
